channel.title: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding
channel.description:
Well, since I got a router when I try to login to my server it always says error connecting, do I have to port forward? and I did try port forwarding but when I typed ipconfig nothing came listed up:
[URL=http://img822.imageshack.us/i/ipconfig.jpg/][IMG]http://img822.imageshack.us/img822/2758/ipconfig.jpg[/img][/URL]
Any Idea what could be wrong please?

item.title: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Dead_Inside Dead Inside
item.description:
@Dead_Inside wrote:

I have to type it in the browser and it should take me to a page were I can do the settings for port forwarding but it’s not working :S

Read full topic
item.source: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding

item.title: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Dead_Inside Dead Inside
item.description:
@Dead_Inside wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:343404”]Type
cd C:\Windows\System32
Than ipconfig[/quote]
I tried that now, when I open ipconfig it closes really fast.
EDIT:
Ok so now I found out what my router ip is, I typed it in the web browser and it’s not taking me to the router page thing :S

Read full topic
item.source: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding

item.title: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If you have a router your ip will most likely be 192.168.1.??? if you go into your router it should have a section show all the devices connected to it. You can also do as death said.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a quick question about router/port forwarding
